message_1: In how many different ways can you choose two items from a collection of ten distinct items?
message_2:
To choose two items from a collection of ten distinct items, you can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

In this case, n = 10 (the total number of items) and k = 2 (the number of items you want to choose). So the formula becomes:

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!(10-2)!)

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2! * 8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 * 9 * 8!)/(2 * 8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 * 9)/(2)

C(10, 2) = 45

So there are 45 different ways to choose two items from a collection of ten distinct items.
